author: Domenic Mastromatteo
title: @template for an abstract fold function
question:
If we have a problem where we need to design an abstract fold function from an already designed template what do we need to include in our template?
I rewatched the lecture video Fold Functions pt. 3: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j1reoBD_mEs
but there is no template included for fold-element at the end. Would the template for fold-element be
(@template Element ListOfElement)? Do we need use-abstract-fn even if we're in the process of creating it? Is it a fn-composition because c1 and c2 both will have a function call in their arguments?
instructor_answer:
Terminology point - the template tag is the thing that looks like (@template Spider).  The template is the body of the template function definition.
The template tag for fold-element would be (@template Element ListOfElement encapsulated).
It does not include use-abstract-fn because you are defining the abstract function not calling it.
